reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: ESARO office PMER support for the Regional programme

description.narrative: In order to improve programme quality and programme development, and ensure strategic guidance and partners? capacity building, it is of essence to have presence in the countries and support PMER. For this to be successful FCA needs to commit long-term fun ding. Networking and attending coordination, sector and cluster meetings are important and also the key when seeking new funding. Working with the local partners successfully requires working hand in hand throughout the project cycle. The field presence is in line with FCA?s regional strategy, and supporting the strategic goals especially related to programme quality, capacity building, advocacy and relationship building with other organisations/actors as well as broadening the funding base.The main objecti ve: The overall objective is to improve effectiveness, quality and impact of the FCA regional programme focusing on the thematic areas, Right to Livelihood, Right to Education and Right to Peace through established field presence.Expected results: ? Strate gic and operational planning for the region including programme and project PME and administrative support ? Established a functional working relationship and collaboration with UN agencies, I/NGOs, CBOs and government authorities at regional and country l evel ? New partnership and networking opportunities are created to broadening the funding opportunities? Dialogue facilitated with authorities and various actors at regional and country level ? Effective coordination of work and cooperation with other aid organisations ? Capacity of local partners are built for effective and efficient programme implementation ? Thematic advice provided to the regional and country programmes and projects ? Support and input ensured for communication purposes ? Effective emer gency response/humanitarian aid provided during disasters ? Resourcing and staffing of the Regional Office and Programme Countries ensured? Management and administration of the Regional Office further strengthened and support to field presence in programme countries provided? Input of partner organisations and topics from the region into the lobby and advocacy work have been increasedPartners:Local and regional civil society actors, international organisations, government, donors
